html:
The new episode just dropped on Hulu.

There have been a lot of Family Guy episodes throughout the many seasons of the animated comedy, but there actually haven't been that many Halloween specials. This is in direct contrast with The Simpsons, which has had a Treehouse of Horror special every year since its second season.

This year, season 23 of Family Guy kicked off with a Halloween episode titled "Peter, Peter, Pumpkin Cheater", which included guest star Glen Powell. If you're hoping to watch every single Family Guy Halloween or horror-themed episode this October, we've put together a quick guide on where to find every one and how to stream them online this year.

Where to Stream Family Guy Halloween Episodes

Hulu Free Trial

Every single Family Guy Halloween episode can currently be streamed on Hulu. This includes the latest episode, which is actually a Hulu exclusive you won't be able to watch anywhere else. For older specials, you can purchase full seasons or individual episodes digitally via Prime Video.

Additionally, you can stream some episodes of Family Guy on demand via a fuboTV subscription, but the seasons are limited and there is only one Halloween episode available titled "Happy Holo-ween". If you decide to opt for Hulu, the streaming service still offers a free 7-day trial for new subscribers or you can bundle it with Disney+ and Max for monthly savings.

Family Guy Halloween Episode List

With the latest special, Family Guy now has a total of eight episodes that directly reference Halloween or classic horror genres in some way. The first official Halloween special arrived in season 9 with "Halloween on Spooner Street" and the latest one just aired on October 14.

  1. Season 4, Episode 26 - "Petergeist"
  2. Season 9, Episode 1 - "And Then There Were Fewer"
  3. Season 9, Episode 4 - "Halloween on Spooner Street"
  4. Season 12, Episode 3 - "Quagmire's Quagmire"
  5. Season 14, Episode 4 - "Peternormal Activity"
  6. Season 20, Episode 3 - "Must Love Dogs"
  7. Season 21, Episode 6 - "Happy Holo-ween"
  8. Season 23, Episode 1 - "Peter, Peter, Pumpkin Eater"

Jacob Kienlen is a Senior SEO Strategist and Writer for IGN. Born and raised in Portland, Oregon, he has considered the Northwest his home for his entire life. With a bachelor's degree in communication and over 7 years of professional writing experience, his expertise is spread across a variety of different topics -- from TV series to indie games and popular book series.

Originally posted: Oct 14, 2024 9:23 pm
